timeline.bodyText:
There is a helpful method in CustomAssertions utility class. Probably it is better to use such method to assert exceptions rather than using @Test(expected = AccessDeniedException.class) cause it allows us to specify only a single line that should fail.
assertThrows(AccessDeniedException.class, () -> preferenceApiService.loadAll())
timeline.author: tcibinan

timeline.bodyText: It seems fine to just call it externalResource or even resource because we are already in the context of the contextual preference test class.
timeline.author: tcibinan

timeline.bodyText: What about calling this loaded preferences list just loadedPreferences. Such result prefix is just a boilerplate giving no additional meaning to the reader :)
timeline.author: tcibinan

replies.bodyText: In case where there is only one assert in the test method we can even inline the variable and don't think about naming it at all.
replies.author: tcibinan

timeline.bodyText: We expect here to be at least a simple user role here so let's add corresponding @WithMockUser annotation.
timeline.author: tcibinan

timeline.bodyText: As discussed with the team let's use @WithMockUser wherever possible. Even while testing methods without acl annotations at all. Specified without arguments it mocks the test with user name and role_user authority.
timeline.author: tcibinan
